learning_objective: Explain tradeoffs when selecting and implementing cybersecurity recommendations.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is a financial advisor and they regularly access online platforms which contain sensitive information about their clients. As a result, they are thinking about enhancing their cybersecurity measures. Which opportunity could Alex consider, while still being mindful of their budget?",
    "Answer1": "Alex could hire a full team of cybersecurity experts to monitor and defend against potential threats 24/7.",
    "Answer2": "They can encrypt their data, ensuring that it is more difficult for unauthorized individuals to access.",
    "Answer3": "They can move all their client's sensitive information to an external hard drive and disconnect it from the internet every time they aren't using it.",
    "Answer4": "They can disable their internet connection completely and conduct all their client meetings face-to-face.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "While all these measures increase security to some degree, they must be balanced against the cost and practicality. Hiring a full-time cybersecurity team can be expensive, and disconnecting from the internet, either when not in use or altogether, can be very limiting and potentially impractical. Data encryption provides a good balance of increased security without incurring significant costs or limiting usability too much."
}
